    def execute(self) -> List[List[NodeExecutionData]]:
        """
        Execute the node operations.
        
        SYNC-CELERY SAFE: All HTTP calls use timeout parameter.
        
        Returns:
            List[List[NodeExecutionData]]: Nested list where outer list is output branches,
            inner list is items in that branch.
        """
        # Get input data from previous node
        input_data = self.get_input_data()
        
        # Handle empty input
        if not input_data:
            return [[]]
        
        return_items: List[NodeExecutionData] = []

        for i, item in enumerate(input_data):
            try:
                resource = self.get_node_parameter("resource", i)
                operation = self.get_node_parameter("operation", i)
                item_data = item.json_data if hasattr(item, 'json_data') else item.get('json', {})
                
                if resource == "issue" and operation == "create":
                    result = self._issue_create(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "issue" and operation == "createComment":
                    result = self._issue_createComment(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "issue" and operation == "edit":
                    result = self._issue_edit(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "issue" and operation == "get":
                    result = self._issue_get(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "issue" and operation == "lock":
                    result = self._issue_lock(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "release" and operation == "create":
                    result = self._release_create(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "release" and operation == "delete":
                    result = self._release_delete(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "release" and operation == "get":
                    result = self._release_get(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "release" and operation == "getAll":
                    result = self._release_getAll(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "release" and operation == "update":
                    result = self._release_update(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "repository" and operation == "get":
                    result = self._repository_get(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "repository" and operation == "getIssues":
                    result = self._repository_getIssues(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "user" and operation == "getRepositories":
                    result = self._user_getRepositories(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "file" and operation == "delete":
                    result = self._file_delete(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "file" and operation == "get":
                    result = self._file_get(i, item_data)
                elif resource == "file" and operation == "list":
                    result = self._file_list(i, item_data)
                else:
                    raise ValueError(f"Unknown resource/operation: {resource}/{operation}")
                
                # Handle array results
                if isinstance(result, list):
                    for r in result:
                        return_items.append(NodeExecutionData(json_data=r))
                else:
                    return_items.append(NodeExecutionData(json_data=result))
                
            except Exception:
                logger.error(f"Error in {resource}/{operation}: {e}")
                if self.continue_on_fail:
                    return_items.append(NodeExecutionData(json_data={"error": str(e)}))
                else:
                    raise
        
        return [return_items]

parameters.name: Get Issues
parameters.description: Get the data of a single repository

parameters.description: Create a new file in repository

parameters.name: assignee_ids
parameters.description: User ID to assign issue to

parameters.name: issueNumber
parameters.description: The number of the issue on which to create the comment on

parameters.name: issueNumber
parameters.description: The number of the issue edit

parameters.name: issueNumber
parameters.description: The number of the issue get data of

parameters.name: issueNumber
parameters.description: The number of the issue to lock

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: If Tag doesn’t exist, the release will be created from Ref. It can be a commit SHA, another tag name, or a branch name.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: The Git tag the release is associated with

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project

parameters.name: returnAll
parameters.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of results to return

parameters.name: additionalFields
parameters.description: The field to use as order

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: The field to use as order

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: The Git tag the release is associated with

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the release. You can use Markdown.

parameters.name: milestones
parameters.description: The title of each milestone to associate with the release (provide a titles list spearated with comma)

parameters.name: released_at
parameters.description: The date when the release is/was ready

parameters.name: getRepositoryIssuesFilters
parameters.description: Return only issues which are assigned to a specific user

parameters.name: assignee_username
parameters.description: Return only issues which are assigned to a specific user

parameters.name: author_username
parameters.description: Return only issues which were created by a specific user

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search issues against their title and description

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Return only issues with the given labels. Multiple lables can be separated by comma.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: Return only issues updated at or after this time

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: The path of the folder to list

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The name of the commit/branch/tag. Default: the repository’s default branch (usually main).

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: Whether or not to get a recursive file tree. Default is false.

parameters.name: asBinaryProperty
parameters.description: Whether to set the data of the file as binary property instead of returning the raw API response

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: The name of the commit/branch/tag. Default: the repository’s default branch (usually main).

parameters.name: binaryData
parameters.description: Whether the data to upload should be taken from binary field

parameters.name: fileContent
parameters.description: The text content of the file

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Name of the new branch to create. The commit is added to this branch.

parameters.name: branchStart
parameters.description: Name of the base branch to create the new branch from

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the author of the commit

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of the author of the commit

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: Change encoding to base64. Default is text.

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: Any time any event is triggered (Wildcard Event)
